creditline: Gift of Leo and Doris Hodroff
description: exterior decorated with ships at front and back of edge, at full sail on a green sea, flying two Union Jacks; central rondel with scene of ten sailors at various pursuits; each sailor has a speech bubble; white ground; two floral sprays on exterior
text: This bowl offers a view of 18th century nautical life with ten sailors engaged in various activities, including catching crabs, carousing, and drinking.  The bowl's text refers to a dispute over sailors' wages under Ship Steward William Brown aboard the <I>Middlesex<I>, a trading ship belonging to England's East India Company.
title: Documentary shipping bowl
